column4: This week, I met with Skip Thole at his small business, Skip's Bagel Deli, in Symmes Township. Skip and I discussed how #PPP funding helped him retain his employees during the COVID-19 pandemic. Thank you for your time and assessment of the program. https://t.co/kEP7PiMsiZ

We discussed the impact of the #COVID19 pandemic on small businesses and how the #PPP funding helped them carry on as an essential business. Thank you for your time and for sharing your experience with me. https://t.co/LnvFjWZkes
.@GovMikeDeWine's #COVID19 press conference is today at 2:00 pm. Tune in for updates and more information on the https://t.co/KDHeS6ytJE. #InThisTogetherOhio

Next, I sat down with Carlisle Mayor Randy Winkler to get an update on current events in his community, the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic, and to discuss my legislative and constituent service work in Congress. Thank you for the thoughtful discussion. https://t.co/S3S4wETHFu

Be sure to tune in to @GovMikeDeWine's #COVID19 press conference on the https://t.co/KDHeS6ytJE at 2 p.m. for updates and information.

#PPP was designed to get aid to our nation’s small businesses quickly so that they could keep their workers on payroll during the pandemic.
 
The @SBAgov worked quickly, and in the first 14 days of the program, they processed over 14 years’ worth of loans.
As the Ranking Member of the House Small Business Committee, I worked with my colleagues on both sides of the aisle to craft the Paycheck Protection Program in response to #COVID.

Unfortunately, some mom and pop shops, especially in minority or underserved areas, had trouble accessing the Paycheck Protection Program.

These small businesses faced structural challenges before COVID-19, and many lacked the necessary relationships with traditional lenders.
Today @ 2pm: Watch @GovMikeDeWine’s #COVID19 update here ➡️ https://t.co/KDHeS6ytJE #InThisTogetherOhio

They discussed the challenges they have faced during the coronavirus pandemic and the business models they have implemented, such as direct-to-consumer sales and home delivery, to keep delivering food across America.

Yesterday, the House Small Business Committee held a hearing on the impact of COVID-19 on our nation’s food supply chain. 

We heard testimony from several witnesses representing parts of that supply chain, including brewery operators, seafood processors, and farmers.

ICYMI: "Food System Small Businesses Share
Challenges, Pivots in Response to COVID-19" https://t.co/rwlFyub6MP
In August, I dropped by the @ManorHouseOhio to meet with Janet & Dave Nelson to discuss how the pandemic has impacted their industry and their business. https://t.co/CZvaT3xSVK
Many thanks to the Mayor for the informative discussion about COVID and the many projects you hope to accomplish.  #InThisTogetherOhio https://t.co/V6KyzTJFr8

Recently, I was pleased to meet with Mayor Lisa Mear of the Village of Addyston.  Although Addyston is one of the smallest municipalities in the First Congressional District, #COVID19 has impacted its residents and economy just as significantly.
REMINDER: Tune in to @GovMikeDeWine’s #COVID19 press conference today at 2 pm on the https://t.co/KDHeS6ytJE. #InThisTogetherOhio

I have enjoyed meeting some of your outstanding students and teachers over the years. (These photos were taken prior to the COVID-19 pandemic and the need for social distancing and masks.) https://t.co/MfXBdCMAkt
As they reopen after public health lockdowns, many small businesses have concerns about worker and customer safety.

Our nation’s small business owners purposely pick the hard path.  They put their hearts into running their business and providing for themselves and their employees.

Too many are still struggling due to COVID-19.
In light of the ongoing opioid epidemic, we must do all we can to make sure that drug prescriptions are used and disposed of in a safe and responsible manner. https://t.co/3FXBQjkv0U

America’s small businesses continue to be challenged by COVID-19. 
 
Yesterday, I spoke on the House floor on behalf of my bill, H.R. 8265, that would reopen the Paycheck Protection Program and deliver support to our nation’s small business owners and their employees.

That common sense approach is needed now, more than ever, as many of these mom and pop shops are still reeling from COVID-19.  

Last week, I introduced a bill, H.R. 8265, that would allow small businesses to apply for a second PPP loan and make the program more flexible.
#ICYMI: “Chabot-Connolly Global Health Security Act Passes House” https://t.co/rXiwIyBkSs

The bipartisan Global Health Security Act will help address diseases where they emerge before they become a global pandemic. 

Health security is national security since diseases similar to #COVID19 are just one plane ride away from America.

The House passed the bipartisan Global Health Security Act, farsighted legislation Rep. @GerryConnolly and I introduced in April 2019 to help prevent diseases like the coronavirus from becoming pandemics. 

Watch my speech on the House Floor here: https://t.co/JO5yHs4n58

Small businesses from Cincinnati to Lebanon have used the Paycheck Protection Program to stay afloat during the initial months of the pandemic.  
 
However, many are still operating at a loss and are uncertain about their future.
This week the SBA will recognize small businesses that have been successful in navigating COVID and sharing best practices.  For more information, click here: https://t.co/I2BSK7UJlJ
As Ranking Member of the House Small Business Committee, I recognize how COVID has impacted small businesses and how hard they are working to recover.

Our nation’s rural small businesses have faced unique challenges, from the Great Recession to the coronavirus pandemic.  

Limited access to broadband, high child care costs, and workforce shortages are just a few issues faced by our rural entrepreneurs and communities.

Yesterday @GovMikeDeWine announced that thousands of Ohio school children who qualify for free or reduced-price meals would receive additional money to purchase nutritious foods through the Pandemic Benefit Transfer program (P-EBT).

As we shift to remote learning, many children in our region and across the state are at risk of not having access to the free or reduced lunch benefits they would typically have in school before the global pandemic hit.

I was pleased to have the chance to meet with Candace S. McGraw, CEO of the Cincinnati/Northern Kentucky Airport (CVG), about COVID19’s impact on CVG.  Thanks to the #CARESAct, airports like CVG were able to save a considerable number of jobs and stay afloat. https://t.co/f9tLSWh3DV

In fact, a few weeks ago, I introduced legislation (H.R. 8087) that would give small businesses the ability to receive a second round of #PPP.  The PPP program enjoys bipartisan support and has helped millions of small businesses survive COVID.
Congress must pass another COVID relief package to provide additional relief to small businesses.

Eligible small businesses in Hamilton County have a second chance to apply for a @theHCDC grant of up to $10,000.  These grants can be used for expenses such as mortgage costs, rent or lease costs, utilities, payroll, and personal protective equipment.

Thanks to funding from the #CARESAct, small businesses in Hamilton County now have a second chance to apply for a grant of up to $10,000 through @theHCDC.  Grant funds can be used for expenses such as mortgage costs, rent, utilities, payroll, and PPE.

Thanks to funding from the #CARESAct, small businesses in @HamiltonCountyOhio now have a second chance to apply for a grant of up to $10,000 through @theHCDC.  Grant funds can be used for expenses such as mortgage costs, rent, utilities, payroll, and PPE.

Today, I had the pleasure of participating in a virtual small business roundtable with panelists from numerous organizations, including @SBA_Columbus, @CityofCincy, and @theHCDC.  Thank you to everyone who participated.

Yesterday, I introduced the MICRO Business Success Act of 2020. This legislation will make additional resources available to businesses with 10 or fewer employees that have been hit hard by coronavirus-related shutdowns.

To help the smallest businesses survive the pandemic, yesterday I introduced a bill that would ensure that at least $20 billion of remaining #PPP money goes to businesses with 10 or fewer workers.

I would like to give a shout out to Bethany House, in South Fairmount, for staying open and accepting homeless and at-risk families during the #COVID19 pandemic. They received #PPP funding, which helped them keep their doors open.

The MICRO Business Success Act:
-Allots $20B of remaining PPP funds for small businesses with 10 employees or fewer.

-Encourages expansion of the smallest businesses through the @SBAgov 504/CDC Loan Program.

This bipartisan amendment to the House-passed #NDAA provides crucial direction in combatting the current #COVID19 pandemic and future similar outbreaks.

House-passed #NDAA includes 5 of my amendments: 
1️⃣ Global Health Security Act
2️⃣ CHEST & Cyber Security Best Practices
3️⃣ China Cyber Strategy
4️⃣ Supporting India Against China’s Territorial Aggression
5️⃣ Accounting for Internally Displaced Persons in Former USSR Countries

At yesterday’s Small Business Committee hearing, we heard from witnesses who talked about past problems and solutions, issues related to COVID-19, and looking toward the future as small businesses recover.

There’s no doubt that small businesses have been hit hard by government-mandated shutdowns due to COVID-19. Long-lasting damage to these businesses could pose real danger to communities around our nation.
